intro: Ebnerella zeilmanniana, commonly known as the Zeilmann's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
